page.title: 04A Garage in Haltwhistle.
page.content: My grandad's garage is on the A69. He sells diesel.and petrol. It costs Â£2.03 a gallon. He has a waggon park beside the garage. He has a{haulage business}at Plenmeller. His garage used to be the old pit yard of the Plenmeller colliery, which closed in 1930. His office was the joiner's shop, and the engine shed is used as a repair depot. He has 19 blue waggons and 54 different trailers. His wagons carry chipboard from the{Weyroc}factory at Hexham to all over England. He brings back Coca-Cola from Milton Keynes, potatoes from Southampton, and woodchips from Wales. He uses Volvo and Foden waggons, and his drivers travel about 1700 miles a week.
